Prepare ELK TOSCA Template for Translation into HOT (3)

of the translated HOT template.

Partially Implements: blueprint translate-tosca-monitoring-usecase

commit_message:
Add flag to force experimental run of db contract

Currently the nova manage contract command is experimental and
can cause destruction of a users database if the database model
has been updated. This will prevent the running of the contract
command unless a user really means it.

Change-Id: Id8a630d547670ab677b76363c4e48dfe8ca22aec
Signed-off-by: Philip Schwartz <philip.schwartz@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Ensure radosgw service enabled on boot

Currently, we are not ensuring that the radowgw service is enabled to
start on boot. This change removes the restart_rados.sh and adds
enable_rados.pp to ensure the service is running and will be started
on boot.

Change-Id: I58bf4a20c9d08ba3e9624fd47e3b5780011c89b7
Closes-Bug: 1466552

commit_message:
Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

Change-Id: I6a35fa0dda798fad93b804d00a46af80f08d475c

commit_message:
Associate floating IPs with first v4 fixed IP if none specified

In the absence of a specified fixed address with which to associate a
floating IP, the first IPv4 address on the port should be associated.
Without the check for IPv4, IPv6 ports can be associated with a (IPv4)
floating IP, which is not supported.

Change-Id: Ib66a9109cc1c7999474daca5970d0af1f70886e4
Closes-Bug: 1437855
(cherry picked from commit c5dfd2c3ef773b29666fae3fe75bf7548044dbf5)

commit_message:
Add virt resource update to ComputeNode object

The virt driver method get_available_resources() returns a dict
to the resource tracker. The fields of will be copied into a
ComputeNode object as an update. The copy is not exact as some
fields may be missing and some are named differently.

We add the method update_from_virt_driver() to the ComputeNode
to perform this update. It is not a remoteable method and does not
change the format or semantics of the object, so this change does
not bump the ComputeNode object version number.

This method will be used in a subsequent patch that replace the
compute_node dict in the resource tracker with a ComputeNode
object.

Change-Id: Ia010e428f400a5b4d0338e79670a0ef60e7d3b03

commit_message:
Remove invalid client config option

Removing the unnecessary config allows clients to run without changing the
results returned by:

> SHOW VARIABLES LIKE  'char%';

Indicating that we have not stepped out of a UTF-8 only configuration.

Closes-bug: #1463457
Change-Id: Ifad24dc9b1b6de6dee14222e29affc584723817b
(cherry picked from commit 64ea2133f16888eb54314ab42d8e5c9f314de075)

commit_message:
CORS Middleware defers to server response.

If this middleware detects a server response with existing CORS
headers, it deactivates itself in favor of what is already provided.
This is to support API's (such as Swift) that permit configurable
CORS rules for exposed endpoints.

Change-Id: Ia416bcf6b4cc28025b8204e2eb936a491e8538a6

commit_message:
Add support for Redis replication

Redis does not currently support the APIs for replication.  This spec
addresses that deficiency.

Change-Id: I6b22d0c5af92854fb4534a6361d95a7b1cbadf28
Related: blueprint redis-replication

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-06-12 21:55:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add support for deploying Keystone with Fernet

This change adds a number of new tasks that are dependent on the value
of the Keystone token provider (keystone_token_provider) user variable.

If the keystone_token_provider user_variable is set to
keystone.token.providers.fernet.Provider then the playbooks will
appropriately create the fernet keys and distribute them to the rest of
the keystone containers.

This also implements key rotation for generated fernet keys similar to
how the os_nova roles implement key rotation.

commit_message:
Add support for deploying Keystone with Fernet

This change adds a number of new tasks that are dependent on the value
of the Keystone token provider (keystone_token_provider) user variable.

If the keystone_token_provider user_variable is set to
keystone.token.providers.fernet.Provider then the playbooks will
appropriately create the fernet keys and distribute them to the rest of
the keystone containers.

This also implements key rotation for generated fernet keys similar to
how the os_nova roles implement key rotation.

Finally, we also need to build cryptography from master for now.
Currently, 0.8.x and 0.9.x use versions of cffi<1.0 which causes a bug
when used with mod_wsgi and Apache. This is fixed in cryptography master
and will be released in 1.0.

Closes-bug: 1463569
Change-Id: I8605e0490a8889d57c6b1b7e03e078fb0da978ab

commit_message:
Added flag to instruct yaprt to ignore tempest

This change makes it possible for OSAD to instruct yaprt to NEVER
do anything with tempest and the requirements that are being
brought with the requirements that can cause issues with un-versioned
requirements. This flag simply instructs yaprt to index the repo
as a item in the report but in this case absolutely no requirements
will be indexed or built for tempest.

This was done because tempest does not version anything and its
forward movement makes it impossible to maintain a consistent stack
and for our purposes, we install tempest in a venv using an isolated
install so none of these tempest requirements are necessary for us
to have to deal with.

Change-Id: I619300352efe50828fc34ee1ded96e13a43522cd
Closes-Bug: #1466010

commit_message:
Consolidate exceptions and extend NovaException

Consolidate all nova-powervm exception classes into a new module,
nova_powervm.virt.powervm.exception, and make sure they all inherit from
NovaException.

Change-Id: Iec10ed588192be19188e0b4d68df3f1eb73e48a2

commit_message:
Allow oslo rabbit heartbeat configuration

In order to allow components to better handle and respond to mq failures,
oslo has some heartbeat options that are useful.

Change-Id: Ibe089a1d2e298f703d3cc6c952e475f5c1990880

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I05a408b76d4f31b803769a27759e91df770511bb

commit_message:
Add a description of the instance_type_rxtx_factor property

The "instance_" prefixed properties are put on images when they're
created using the Compute API. Add the instance_type_rxtx_factor
property which is one of glance image properties.

Change-Id: Ieb8568974dd5c97c912e621b2323bb0e06c402e6
Closes-Bug: #1330005

Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for network_create_safe

This patches removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
network_create_safe.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

commit_message:
Pass project_id when create networks by os-tenant-networks

os-tenant-networks API is called by normal user. So the create action
should be allowed to create new network which belong to the requester.

This patch passes the project_id down to the nova manager, then make
it create a new network belong to the requester.

The db call network_create_safe is still admin required. That will be
fixed by db permission cleanup patch later.

Change-Id: Iff6ed417a297dcb1594d6871ea18119ce3b3e7b0
Partial-Bug: #1432101

commit_message:
Disassociate before deleting network in os-tenant-networks delete method

The create of os-tenant-networks method should only create the network
which belong to the request user. So the delete method will always be
used to delete a network which already associate with project. This
patch fixed delete method call the disassociate first.

Change-Id: I97fd1d607b5eecdf4a501608a5ed258888d36d37
Partial-Bug: #1432101

commit_message:
Begin the installation process

This has minimal hardware requirements (slightly modified from the
old ha-guide) and the first procedural steps for setting up ones
HA environment.  The information is scant and mostly reflects what
is in the old guide.  It should contain all steps to be taken before
one begins to configure the HA controller cluster.

Change-Id: If28d64ba9e6ae3aa13be526f543a26164aea5e8e

commit_message:
Convert HA Pacemaker/Corosync info to RST

This converts the Pacemaker/Corosync information from the old ha guide
to RST and places it in the new structure.  It includes a few minor
edits but updating and correcting the information is deferred to a new
CR after this is merged.

Change-Id: I5ae694f4e4db0c198834cee85fedc0067bd9936f

commit_message:
Horizon Karma test job is now voting

The horizon npm lint job is still non-voting, and all npm-run
jobs do not run against icehouse or juno. The npm-test run has
also been added to the gate queue.

commit_message:
Allow galera wsrep_provider_options to be customised

This patch introduces galera_wsrep_provider_options as a list of
options instead of only catering for changing the gcache.size
option. This allows the deployer to change any number of the
wsrep_provider_options available.

Note: The variable galera_gcache_size is respected in this patch
but if galera_wsrep_provider_options is customised by a deployer
then the custom list must include reference to galera_gcache_size
for it to be respected.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1464699
Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <ian.cordasco@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I78a5a1d344729fdc06636b1c6dade63a7ba59e94

commit_message:
Add adjust_blueprints.py script

adjust_blueprints.py is meant to be run just before milestone tagging,
to target recently-implemented blueprints to the milestone (and set the
series goal), and clear the milestone target from any incomplete
blueprint that may still have it.

It is part of the new "report rather than predict" approach to blueprint
tracking.

Change-Id: I84d185da32fa0c0caeadd29ad9a7fc010953d080

commit_message:
Prevent creation of nameless plans

Some basic sanity checking to make sure every row that goes into the
plan table can be deserialized into a proper Plan object. The first
of these checks is that the name is present and matches a standard
regex (borrowed from our own python-solumclient code).

Change-Id: Ia980c28721a327fa2fd8fc4537a397ae819c5dd6
Closes-Bug: 1459003

commit_message:
Add unit tests for PCI utils

The following functions were previously untested. The unit test coverage for
all of pci/utils.py is now 100% (was 38%).

    - get_function_by_ifname
    - is_physical_function
    - get_ifname_by_pci_address
    - get_vf_num_by_pci_address

Change-Id: I23eb617a261cd75b8823bf315804289475f7ed85

subject: Remove invalid client config option
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-20 22:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/galera_config/templates/my.cnf'], 'message': "Remove invalid client config option

Removing the unnecessary config allows clients to run without changing the
results returned by:

> SHOW VARIABLES LIKE  'char%';

Indicating that we have not stepped out of a UTF-8 only configuration.

Closes-bug: #1463457
Change-Id: Ifad24dc9b1b6de6dee14222e29affc584723817b
(cherry picked from commit 64ea2133f16888eb54314ab42d8e5c9f314de075)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove invalid client config option

Removing the unnecessary config allows clients to run without changing the
results returned by:

> SHOW VARIABLES LIKE  'char%';

Indicating that we have not stepped out of a UTF-8 only configuration.

Closes-bug: #1463457
Change-Id: Ifad24dc9b1b6de6dee14222e29affc584723817b
(cherry picked from commit 64ea2133f16888eb54314ab42d8e5c9f314de075)

subject: corrected the wrong return value in lbaas test case
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-22 13:44:56.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/lbaas_tests.py'], 'message': "corrected the wrong return value in lbaas test case

In 'LbaasApiTests.test_pool_get' test case 'show_health_monitor' api
is returning wrong value. It should return dict of 'health_monitor' dict.

Actually it is returning dict of 'health_monitors' list, which is wrong.

This patch modifying the test case to return expected value.

Change-Id: Ia68bab3f71a9ebab5018061c76cd8eda6b09e66c
Closes-Bug: #1467516
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
corrected the wrong return value in lbaas test case

In 'LbaasApiTests.test_pool_get' test case 'show_health_monitor' api
is returning wrong value. It should return dict of 'health_monitor' dict.

Actually it is returning dict of 'health_monitors' list, which is wrong.

This patch modifying the test case to return expected value.

Change-Id: Ia68bab3f71a9ebab5018061c76cd8eda6b09e66c
Closes-Bug: #1467516

commit_message:
Pin cinderclient

cinderclient 1.2.x is broken for all public clouds tested. What's worse
is that the break exhibits as hanging until timeout because of errors in
version autonegotiation.

pin so that people aren't confused and angry.

Change-Id: Ia3896f3ac38ded6225447bd4cbd03a086e741ad0

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-17 10:15:43.000000000', 'files': ['etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/debug.filters'], 'message': 'fix rootwrap debug filter for ping all

NeutronDebugAgent.ping_all calls ping with "-c 1 -w <number>' so
the filter should accept this order, and not only "-w .. -c ..".

Not changing the existing filter to not break other tools
that might use -w -c in that order.

Change-Id: I5b3d67dfcdc15c53ac3bf2fb39de29fd97e98a19
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fix rootwrap debug filter for ping all

NeutronDebugAgent.ping_all calls ping with "-c 1 -w <number>' so
the filter should accept this order, and not only "-w .. -c ..".

Not changing the existing filter to not break other tools
that might use -w -c in that order.

Change-Id: I5b3d67dfcdc15c53ac3bf2fb39de29fd97e98a19

commit_message:
Add extension entry-points and loading

This allows Bandit to be extended by third-party packages with both
plugins and formatters. It also updates Bandit's existing in-tree
formatters to be loaded by the plugin manager. When running

    $ bandit -h

The loaded plugins will be displayed to the user if any are installed.

Change-Id: I102277dcd9481f2573028a436e910eda10011d91

commit_message:
devstack: Add devstackgaterc file

Add a devstackgaterc file to be used by our tempest CI job.  This
will let us tweak the regex used to select which tempest tests run by
updating this file instead of updating the job definition in the
project-config repo.

Change-Id: If191fcec235af839b0946751965f94298be99e26
Depends-on: I43f00d889fc44b7d5a43a60b729bf8e9ada1eb22
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

subject: Missing template file on update fails silently
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-18 10:30:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Missing template file on update fails silently

When the template file for a template/facade/provider resource is
not found in the new files list when doing a stack update, Heat
silently falls back to using the existing template (i.e. so no
change will be made).
The cause is that the update code shares the same code path for
obtaining the template as the init code. The init code needs to
have a fallback, so that loading the (parent) stack never fails,
however in the update case it is undesirable.

Change-Id: If5a60e23623cc39b98164ddc752bf95435289e27
Closes-Bug: #1452520
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-18 21:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_provider_template.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py'], 'message': 'Missing template file on update fails silently

silently falls back to using the existing template (i.e. so no
change will be made).
The cause is that the update code shares the same code path for
obtaining the template as the init code. The init code needs to
have a fallback, so that loading the (parent) stack never fails,
however in the update case it is undesirable.

(cherry-picked from Id12b63d9f04caba8e9325aed0ee2acf51ffe0c4c)
Change-Id: If5a60e23623cc39b98164ddc752bf95435289e27
Closes-Bug: #1452520', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Missing template file on update fails silently

When the template file for a template/facade/provider resource is
not found in the new files list when doing a stack update, Heat
silently falls back to using the existing template (i.e. so no
change will be made).
The cause is that the update code shares the same code path for
obtaining the template as the init code. The init code needs to
have a fallback, so that loading the (parent) stack never fails,
however in the update case it is undesirable.

(cherry-picked from Id12b63d9f04caba8e9325aed0ee2acf51ffe0c4c)
Change-Id: If5a60e23623cc39b98164ddc752bf95435289e27
Closes-Bug: #1452520

commit_message:
Add openid connect client support

This patch allows a federated user to obtain an unscoped token by
providing login credentials for a keystone identity provider.

The current implementation should work with any properly configured
openid connect provider.

partially implements bp openid-connect

Change-Id: Iade52b5c1432d64582cbaa8bac41ac6366c210f9

commit_message:
Add tooz service group driver

This specification proposes adding a new service group driver based that
makes use of tooz (a new oslo library).

It also talks about deprecating the existing Zookeeper and Memcache
service group drivers, and a migration strategy to the new tooz driver.

blueprint tooz-for-service-groups

Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john.garbutt@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I65198fe507a11a1efd9f90e2f56d91023b689099

commit_message:
Add List of Group-IDs to ACL for Secrets/Containers

The current access control list (ACL) approach in Barbican only allows
for adding user IDs for access to a given secret or container. This
blueprint proposes allowing group IDs to be added to ACLs to
accommodate users within specified groups access to
secrets/containers as well. Adding group support to ACLs would support
LDAP group based access to secrets/containers.

This blueprint depends on the approval of a Keystone blueprint:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/188564/

Change-Id: I80b4d5506ad0cb289f77db8ad0d9632bea9ae474
Implements: blueprint api-acl-add-group-list
APIImpact: Update /v1/.../acls resource to add new 'groups' list
DocImpact: Update acls resource docs to mention a new 'groups' list
SecurityImpact: Adds a new means to access secrets and containers

Change-Id: I2cfdcfce606272fbdbdf8a463db895d3d5a4a1e3
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-21 18:53:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix intermittent error in unit tests

After the introduction of unit tests for the _neutron_exceptions
context, unit tests fail randomly with the following error:

    AttributeError: <class 'shade.OpenStackCloud'> does not have the 
    attribute 'mock_me'

This error is probably due to a funny integration of Mock with the
injection of mock_me method and it probably happens during TestCase
setUp().

Moving the injection of mock_me() into the specific tests in which it
is needed, we skip all the initialization code, reducing the surface
for racing conditions and possibly eliminating the issue completely.

commit_message:
Fix intermittent error in unit tests

After the introduction of unit tests for the _neutron_exceptions
context, unit tests fail randomly with the following error:

    AttributeError: <class 'shade.OpenStackCloud'> does not have the
    attribute 'mock_me'

This error is due to the wrong location of test__neutron_excetpions
tests (i.e. the TestShadeOperator class rather than the TestShade
class).
Moreover, as pointed out on IRC we can get rid of "fake" methods to test
 the  _neutron_exception context, just using the existing code.

Change-Id: I2cfdcfce606272fbdbdf8a463db895d3d5a4a1e3

commit_message:
xenapi: remove bittorrent entry point lookup code

There are no in-tree entry points for the xenapi bittorrent store so
remove the code that was doing this.

If this is needed, it should be done using stevedore now and the entry
points should be registered in setup.cfg.

Closes-Bug: #1453909

Change-Id: I2f0a2888fe500ea8725d33775c0db7b2b6201e18

commit_message:
Do not use a mutable as default argument

LaunchImageNG was using a mutable as default argument
Using None and setting the default mutable only if None.

commit_message:
Distinguish a preliminary address association test

AWS can associate an address to a subnet IP while the subnet is not
accessible from Internet due to its route table restriction.

We need to have this test case separated to have a clear mark of
supporting the feature by ec2api.

Change-Id: I86471b6656ceac2ef01002f5db0c27e6cdb69e42

subject: Just do the basics for the pep8/flake8/hacking tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-19 12:15:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Just do the basics for the pep8/flake8/hacking tests

Prior to this change the `tox -epep8` target would install all of
ceilometer and its requirements for no apparent reason. This changes
makes it so hacking installed (which gets flake8 and pep8) and then
the code is checked. Done. Much faster. And faster is better.

Change-Id: Ibddf4e58887742e4d0dba8e0061b650e85bde46f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Just do the basics for the pep8/flake8/hacking tests

Prior to this change the `tox -epep8` target would install all of
ceilometer and its requirements for no apparent reason. This changes
makes it so hacking installed (which gets flake8 and pep8) and then
the code is checked. Done. Much faster. And faster is better.

Change-Id: Ibddf4e58887742e4d0dba8e0061b650e85bde46f

commit_message:
Install g-r version of OSC in configure_tempest

configure_tempest uses python-openstackclient (OSC) and we call
configure_tempest in grenade on the new side. So we need to make sure
the version of OSC is installed matches global-requirements on new.

Change-Id: I6fae9b8b081355b45e7c8d622d8db2482d41b464
Closes-Bug: #1454467

commit_message:
Initial translation setup

The infra scripts for interacting with our translation server
(transifex) need pot files in the projects to work correctly.

These pot files have been generated using the same method as the infra
scripts.

The file searchlight/locale/searchlight.pot is already checked in, add
the remaining files.

Any future updates of these files will be proposed by the OpenStack Proposal
Bot - including import of translated files once the translation team has
translated files in a sufficient way.

Change-Id: If55edf670c3143337f4e8c7b480547bf152a02ba

commit_message:
Add neutron.conf [database] options

This commit adds the following configuration options to the
neutron.conf template:
  - max_overflow

commit_message:
Add configurable option [cinder]/cross_az_attach

nova has the configuration option [cinder]/cross_az_attach with a
default of True. This option allows attaching between instances and
volumes in different availability zones.

This commit makes this option configurable in the nova.conf template
and uses a default of True.

Change-Id: Ia95f3d4447b026a8e93c74a8c65a63dcea89994f
Closes-bug: 1457140

subject: Eventlet+DNSPython breaks /etc/hosts resolution
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-13 09:49:51.000000000', 'files': ['designate/__init__.py'], 'message': "Eventlet+DNSPython breaks /etc/hosts resolution

Eventlet's GreenDNS Patching will prevent the resolution of names in
the /etc/hosts file, causing problems for for installs. By forcing
the EVENTLET_NO_GREENDNS=yes environment variable, we tell eventlet
not to patch the stdlib's DNS functions with dnspython.

Change-Id: I08b91c598f2904fe8d82827a35b187ae8a4d5d0d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Eventlet+DNSPython breaks /etc/hosts resolution

Eventlet's GreenDNS Patching will prevent the resolution of names in
the /etc/hosts file, causing problems for for installs. By forcing
the EVENTLET_NO_GREENDNS=yes environment variable, we tell eventlet
not to patch the stdlib's DNS functions with dnspython.

Change-Id: I08b91c598f2904fe8d82827a35b187ae8a4d5d0d

Change job logging so we always save logs along with
changing the file ownership on the copied log files such
that the CI system can save them.

commit_message:
Refactor Barbican model registration

This refactors our Barbican models to be registered in the way that
SQLAlchemy suggests, and no longer maintains our own custom registration
code. References: http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/extensions/declarative/basic_use.html#accessing-the-metadata 

Change-Id: Ib8b1460d46e793e1bc5e250df72b62d02c57226e

OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL are no longer required in local_settings

commit_message:
Correct local_settings when AVAILABLE_REGIONS is set

As per the discussion in https://review.openstack.org/190302:

When AVAILABLE_REGIONS is set, OPENSTACK_HOST and
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL are no longer required in local_settings
as per Horizon developer documentation.

This patch implements this either/or configuration.

Change-Id: Iee9b41c34f770f2e8d76ef0e1e1a974f286ca6a9
Closes-Bug: #1463772

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 09:56:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Wrap ML2 delete_port with db retry decorator

ML2 delete_port operation currently involves locking ports
and bindings tables which may lead to DBDeadlock errors in certain
cases when several ports are deleted concurrently.
That may happen due to specifics of Galera working in active-active
mode when it may throw fictitious deadlock errors
The fix adds retries to delete port operation to overcome such
deadlocks

Closes-Bug: #1422504
Change-Id: I684691d59c5ac370d74314c3c91857dc709b2d9b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-02 07:40:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Wrap ML2 delete_port with db retry decorator

ML2 delete_port operation currently involves locking ports
and bindings tables which may lead to DBDeadlock errors in certain
cases when several ports are deleted concurrently.
That may happen due to specifics of Galera working in active-active
mode: it may throw deadlock errors when it fails to validate 
a change with other members of the cluster.
The fix adds retries to delete port operation to overcome such
deadlocks

Closes-Bug: #1422504
Change-Id: I684691d59c5ac370d74314c3c91857dc709b2d9b
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-06-03 05:44:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Wrap ML2 delete_port with db retry decorator

ML2 delete_port operation currently involves locking ports
and bindings tables which may lead to DBDeadlock errors in certain
cases when several ports are deleted concurrently.
That may happen due to specifics of Galera working in active-active
mode: it may throw deadlock errors when it fails to validate
a change with other members of the cluster.
The fix adds retries to delete port operation to overcome such
deadlocks

Closes-Bug: #1422504
Change-Id: I684691d59c5ac370d74314c3c91857dc709b2d9b
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Wrap ML2 delete_port with db retry decorator

ML2 delete_port operation currently involves locking ports
and bindings tables which may lead to DBDeadlock errors in certain
cases when several ports are deleted concurrently.
That may happen due to specifics of Galera working in active-active
mode: it may throw deadlock errors when it fails to validate
a change with other members of the cluster.
The fix adds retries to delete port operation to overcome such
deadlocks

Closes-Bug: #1422504
Change-Id: I684691d59c5ac370d74314c3c91857dc709b2d9b

commit_message:
MOS-RN6.1 Horizon known issues

Adds Horizon known issues to the MOS 6.1 Release
Notes:
- Button Deassociate floating IP disappeared
from Horizon menu;
- In a multi-region environment Horizon logs into incorrect region.

commit_message:

There is an issue where the pre_error table failed to populate with
the not keyword.  Modified the tests to match with row with favor
that is not allowed

commit_message:
Use very long functional test linger

Five seconds is not enough on the gate which seems to run real
slow at times.  I'm thinking 15 seconds will be a lot more
reliable.

Change-Id: I8a3af452c43771aaf01634590fc60145ad898636

subject: Use a more unique postgresql port
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-19 13:44:53.000000000', 'files': ['setup-postgresql-tests.sh'], 'message': "Use a more unique postgresql port

If you try to run the gnocchi postgresql tests at the same time as
ceilometer then things break.

A better solution would be to seek for an unused port but that's
overkill at this point.

Change-Id: Id57851aefa9e1b0f95b172d3facdad5447641c1f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use a more unique postgresql port

If you try to run the gnocchi postgresql tests at the same time as
ceilometer then things break.

A better solution would be to seek for an unused port but that's
overkill at this point.

Change-Id: Id57851aefa9e1b0f95b172d3facdad5447641c1f

commit_message:
Make readonly field tests use exception from oslo.versionedobjects

This cleans up a tactical change in the previous patch by removing the
readonly exception from nova's module and modifying the tests that check
for this behavior to catch the library's exception directly.

Related to blueprint use-oslo-objects

Change-Id: I49ef7f10ea73744e886d95423e49f86c8be93258

commit_message:
Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

Also new version was updated in resources with SupportStatus version 2015.2.

subject: Provide a config option to customize remote shell command
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-18 21:02:59.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py', 'etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Provide a config option to customize remote shell command

Our remote ssh code makes all kinds of assumptions about the shell and
path of the guest. Recently some code was added to the command to generate
errors more promptly but it does not work if the shell is /bin/sh. This
commit allows the user to configure tempest with a desired prologue to handle
this case. It does nothing to solve the more general problem and, like the
other image-related options, cannot be customized individually for various
images that tempest may use.

Debug logging of remote commands was also added.

Change-Id: I669dd4386ffb539dad88a9487bef6c172b5d65fa
Closes-Bug: #1465682
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Provide a config option to customize remote shell command

Our remote ssh code makes all kinds of assumptions about the shell and
path of the guest. Recently some code was added to the command to generate
errors more promptly but it does not work if the shell is /bin/sh. This
commit allows the user to configure tempest with a desired prologue to handle
this case. It does nothing to solve the more general problem and, like the
other image-related options, cannot be customized individually for various
images that tempest may use.

Debug logging of remote commands was also added.

Change-Id: I669dd4386ffb539dad88a9487bef6c172b5d65fa
Closes-Bug: #1465682

Checking if use_linked_clone is None doesn't make any sense because this
is boolean config property which is either True or False (default is
True). If the user hasn't specified a boolean value, the configuration
framework will raise ConfigFileValueError, so there is no need to make
this check in Nova.

Change-Id: I9af15e16cc4ea2779c74b38ad40edf1a2d06d1d1
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VMware: Remove configuration check

Checking if use_linked_clone is None doesn't make any sense because this
is boolean config property which is either True or False (default is
True). If the user hasn't specified a boolean value, the configuration
framework will raise ConfigFileValueError, so there is no need to make
this check in Nova.

Change-Id: I9af15e16cc4ea2779c74b38ad40edf1a2d06d1d1

commit_message:
re-enable glance notification tests

introduced in Id049b6cb8ab3092c50f35894cf5a6bda7ff04617 and
disabled by I763212bad849980bea7fdb96384a5fba7889cce7

improvements to sql backend were made in Juno (see bug)

this patch re-enables the tests and makes a modification to the
expected list of meters (some of original meters are deprecated)

Related-Bug: #1351627

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 03:44:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Initial Heat template for Mesos

The template provision a Mesos cluster with Marathon and Docker.
It is assumed that users provide a Ubuntu base image with Mesos
pre-installed (how to build such image will be documented in another
patch). A provisioned Mesos cluster consists of two types of nodes:
master and slave.

A master node will have the following processes running:
* Zookeeper: A distributed configuration and service discovery service.
* Mesos-master: A process for orchestrating the running of tasks on slaves.
* Marathon: A cluster-wide init and control system for services.

A slave node will have the following processes running:
* Docker: The container engine.
* Mesos-slave: A process for running tasks.

The following features are NOT yet supported:
* Docker storage support.
* Docker network (Flannel or Neutron support).
* Multiple Mesos master nodes.
* Additional Mesos frameworks (i.e. Chronos, Aurora, etc.).
Some of them will be addressed in later patches. Some of them need further
discussion.

Change-Id: Ibf1be3cfb44290d64798865cd18e47c95d937e93
Partial-Implements: blueprint mesos-bay-type

commit_message:
Initial Heat template for Mesos

The template provision a Mesos cluster with Marathon and Docker.
It is assumed that users provide a Ubuntu base image with Mesos
pre-installed (how to build such image will be documented in another
patch). A provisioned Mesos cluster consists of two types of nodes:
master and slave.

A master node will have the following processes running:
* Zookeeper: A distributed configuration and service discovery service.
* Mesos-master: A process for orchestrating the running of tasks on slaves.
* Marathon: A cluster-wide init and control system for services.

A slave node will have the following processes running:
* Docker: The container engine.
* Mesos-slave: A process for running tasks.

The following features are NOT yet supported:
* Docker storage support.
* Docker network (Flannel or Neutron support).
* Multiple Mesos master nodes.
* Additional Mesos frameworks (i.e. Chronos, Aurora, etc.).
Some of them will be addressed in later patches. Some of them need further
discussion.

Change-Id: Ibf1be3cfb44290d64798865cd18e47c95d937e93
Partial-Implements: blueprint mesos-bay-type

commit_message:
Rename openid to oidc in test_auth_plugins.conf

For OpenID Connect We are going to use auth method name 'oidc' not
'openid', and this should be reflected in test_auth_plugins.conf as well.

Implements: bp openid-connect

Change-Id: I607badad84c879c10c70fcad18c2953034ce0895

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fix virtual hard disk detach

Nova Hyper-V driver fails to detach virtual hard disks when using
the virtualizaton v1 WMI namespace. This affects Windows Server
2008 as well as Windows Server 2012 when the old namespace is used.

The reason is that it cannot find the attached resource,
using the wrong resource object connection attribute.

This patch fixes the issue by using the right resource connection
attribute when attempting to find an attached virtual disk resource
by its path.

Closes-Bug: 1467451

Change-Id: Ic1b8eaec8d3f5093c6d518a305fd0d40045030c1
(cherry picked from commit bd78596f2eb659315e9577eec528c5135f481ef6)

commit_message:

Currently chapter 10 is the case study for identity management, and
this will move it into the end of chapter 6 (Identity), and adding
the new section_ file included in identity chapter file.

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fix virtual hard disk detach

Nova Hyper-V driver fails to detach virtual hard disks when using
the virtualizaton v1 WMI namespace. This affects Windows Server
2008 as well as Windows Server 2012 when the old namespace is used.

The reason is that it cannot find the attached resource,
using the wrong resource object connection attribute.

This patch fixes the issue by using the right resource connection
attribute when attempting to find an attached virtual disk resource
by its path.

Closes-Bug: 1467451

Change-Id: Ic1b8eaec8d3f5093c6d518a305fd0d40045030c1

commit_message:
Use correct oslo_middleware.base methods in CORS middleware.

This patch modifies the CORS middleware to use the __call__ logic
from its parent class, rather than overriding it. Logic has been
moved into process_request and process_response accordingly.

Change-Id: Ia5907ec37c1103a9b9a24d549a81822b1b3ad332

subject: Added request to parse_response
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-11 18:42:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Added request to parse_response

This adds the 'request' parameter to the base middleware's
parse_response method. It is intended to support middleware whose
logic is conditional on the request. For example, response header
decorators that respond only to the presence of certain request
headers (If-Not-Match, If-Modified-Since, Origin, etc).

The request parameter has been made optional, in order to be
backwards compatible with older middleware.

Change-Id: I5fa94f74765f14bcf79c48ba4c813929da449be3

The request parameter has been made optional, in order to be

", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-06-16 22:18:53.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/base.py', 'oslo_middleware/tests/test_base.py'], 'message': "Added request to parse_response

logic is conditional on the request. For example, response header
decorators that respond only to the presence of certain request

commit_message:
Added request to parse_response

This adds the 'request' parameter to the base middleware's
parse_response method. It is intended to support middleware whose
logic is conditional on the request. For example, response header
decorators that respond only to the presence of certain request
headers (If-Not-Match, If-Modified-Since, Origin, etc).

The request parameter has been made optional, in order to be
backwards compatible with older middleware. Additional inspection
has been provided, as well as tests for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I5fa94f74765f14bcf79c48ba4c813929da449be3

subject: Better handling of package dependencies in nova generic_service
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-15 23:08:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Declare package with $package_name, not $nova_title

Declare the package with title $package_name rather than $nova_title
to match the prior check if the package already exists in the catalog.

Otherwise, it's possible to end up with a duplicate package definition,
or, more likely, the dependency from the service definition to break.
This occurs most specifically with the spicehtml5proxy class on
EL-based platforms.

Change-Id: I215a95cac1d4b97837b67b417ff5fd7e6e9480d6

commit_message:
Better handling of package dependencies in nova generic_service

Before defining the package for the generic_service, check if it is
already defined, either by $noval_title or $package_name naming.
Create dependency relationship(s) with the service resource based
on how the package is defined in the catalog.

Otherwise, it's possible to end up with a duplicate package definition,
or, more likely, the dependency from the service definition to break.
This occurs most specifically with the spicehtml5proxy class on
EL-based platforms.

Change-Id: I215a95cac1d4b97837b67b417ff5fd7e6e9480d6
Closes-bug: 1465433

commit_message:
MOS6.0 release notes MU section update

Fixes to "How to update product" part of release notes.

    1. Automated part is first now
    2. Removed "case with an access to the Internet on nodes"
    3. Added clarifying about restarting services after update
    4. Added note about that contents of MU is only OpenStack
       packages

Change-Id: Iddf609f3a5b7e9ea7e5f339dbe1ef423605a98c9

commit_message:
Add common function for v2 API flavor_get.

There are objects.Flaovr.get_by_flavor_id function in API layer
we need to catch FlavorNotFound every time. This patch make a
common function and catch FlavorNotFound in V2 API

Also, No FlavorNotFound will be reported by flavor.save function,
so also remove incorrect test cases.

Change-Id: I49402f0652a373b08c5bbd2d7e8ed56b4d1e240f

commit_message:
Use a signal name->sigval and sigval->signal name mapping

We can avoid recalculating and creating these by just having these
mappings be module level constants that are created on import time
and avoid recreating them again and again as needed.

Change-Id: Idaf771dc7c7652d35005f0d767bd857c0547b0fe

commit_message:
libvirt: Don't fetch kernel/ramdisk files if you already have them.

On hard reboot don't fetch the backing image files from Glance
if nova already has them. This also resolves the problem of
getting an ImageNotFound exception in the case where the image
was previously deleted from Glance.

Closes bug: #1430966

Change-Id: Ib61af11422baaf74a62e76b9ec18ce5e6e2e4b19

commit_message:
Rename ilo_power._attach_boot_iso to improve readability

This patch improves source code readability which is a reflection of
iRMC virtual media code review comment [1] to ilo virtual media
reference source code.
It was advised that _attach_boot_iso() is better to be changed to
_attach_boot_iso_if_needed().

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151958/24/ironic/drivers/modules/irmc/deploy.py

Change-Id: I03c65fc1d5b82af13a7322a65bf7ad9157066c79

subject: Fixes "Hyper-V destroy vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2"
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-22 12:23:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes "Hyper-V destroy vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2"

Delete vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2 with the following error:

[Error 145] The directory is not empty: 'C:\\OpenStack\\Instances\\instance-00000003'

This is happening because on Windows 2008R2 it takes a while (1-2 sec. )
for Hyper-V to delete the instance specific files that it stores in the
instance folder.

This patch fixes this bug by adding a retry in the delete method if
it gets that specific error: WindowsError 145

Closes Bug: 1467409
Change-Id: I6d907abde256575cd58b368578dd4b940603c619
(cherry picked from commit c972154be23e12bd097eacc6cae8ccc82b9d9c2b)
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-22 12:24:47.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/pathutils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_pathutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes "Hyper-V destroy vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2"

Delete vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2 with the following error:

[Error 145] The directory is not empty: 'C:\\OpenStack\\Instances\\instance-00000003'

This is happening because on Windows 2008R2 it takes a while (1-2 sec. )
for Hyper-V to delete the instance specific files that it stores in the
instance folder.

This patch fixes this bug by adding a retry in the delete method if

Closes Bug: 1467409
Change-Id: I6d907abde256575cd58b368578dd4b940603c619
(cherry picked from commit c972154be23e12bd097eacc6cae8ccc82b9d9c2b)

commit_message:
Fixes "Hyper-V destroy vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2"

Delete vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2 with the following error:

[Error 145] The directory is not empty: 'C:\\OpenStack\\Instances\\instance-00000003'

This is happening because on Windows 2008R2 it takes a while (1-2 sec. )
for Hyper-V to delete the instance specific files that it stores in the
instance folder.

This patch fixes this bug by adding a retry in the delete method if
it gets that specific error: WindowsError 145

Closes Bug: 1467409
Change-Id: I6d907abde256575cd58b368578dd4b940603c619
(cherry picked from commit c972154be23e12bd097eacc6cae8ccc82b9d9c2b)

subject: Fixes "Hyper-V destroy vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2"
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-22 07:53:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes "Hyper-V destroy vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2"

Delete vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2 with the following error:

[Error 145] The directory is not empty: 'C:\\OpenStack\\Instances\\instance-00000003'

This is happening because on Windows 2008R2 it takes a while (1-2 sec. )
for Hyper-V to delete the instance specific files that it stores in the
instance folder.

This patch fixes this bug by adding a retry in the delete method if
it gets that specific error: WindowsError 145

Closes Bug: 1467409
Change-Id: I6d907abde256575cd58b368578dd4b940603c619
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-22 11:36:13.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/pathutils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_pathutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes "Hyper-V destroy vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2"

Delete vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2 with the following error:

[Error 145] The directory is not empty: 'C:\\OpenStack\\Instances\\instance-00000003'

This is happening because on Windows 2008R2 it takes a while (1-2 sec. )
for Hyper-V to delete the instance specific files that it stores in the
instance folder.

This patch fixes this bug by adding a retry in the delete method if
it gets that specific error: WindowsError 145

Closes Bug: 1467409
Change-Id: I6d907abde256575cd58b368578dd4b940603c619
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fixes "Hyper-V destroy vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2"

Delete vm fails on Windows Server 2008R2 with the following error:

[Error 145] The directory is not empty: 'C:\\OpenStack\\Instances\\instance-00000003'

This is happening because on Windows 2008R2 it takes a while (1-2 sec. )
for Hyper-V to delete the instance specific files that it stores in the
instance folder.

This patch fixes this bug by adding a retry in the delete method if
it gets that specific error: WindowsError 145

Closes Bug: 1467409
Change-Id: I6d907abde256575cd58b368578dd4b940603c619

subject: Setup Translations
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-22 12:07:11.000000000', 'files': ['ironic-inspector/locale/ironic-inspector-log-critical.pot', 'ironic-inspector/locale/ironic-inspector-log-warning.pot', 'ironic-inspector/locale/ironic-inspector.pot', 'ironic-inspector/locale/ironic-inspector-log-error.pot', 'ironic-inspector/locale/ironic-inspector-log-info.pot', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Setup Translations

The infra scripts for interacting with our translation server
(transifex) need pot files in the projects to work correctly.

These pot files have been generated using the same method as the infra
scripts.

Note that the infra scripts expect locale files in directory $REPO/locale/, thus
setup.cfg was changed and the existing pot file moved around so that the
infra scripts find everything.

Any future updates of these files will be proposed by the OpenStack
Proposal Bot - including import of translated files once the translation team has
translated files in a sufficient way.

Change-Id: I4f9260c2cfc1605fc2957529f3874750a0cfb0e6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Setup Translations

The infra scripts for interacting with our translation server
(transifex) need pot files in the projects to work correctly.

These pot files have been generated using the same method as the infra
scripts.

Note that the infra scripts expect locale files in directory $REPO/locale/, thus
setup.cfg was changed and the existing pot file moved around so that the
infra scripts find everything.

Any future updates of these files will be proposed by the OpenStack
Proposal Bot - including import of translated files once the translation team has
translated files in a sufficient way.

Change-Id: I4f9260c2cfc1605fc2957529f3874750a0cfb0e6

commit_message:
Make use of graduated oslo.log module

* use oslo.log for logging functionality
* get rid of the file /mistral/openstack/common/log.py

Implements: blueprint mistral-log-enhancement
Partial-Bug: #1459188

Change-Id: I6b62cffda0a20b6caf59cc30bcc33c21ae1e5898

commit_message:
[RN6.1] Known issues edits

1) Adds Intel X540-AT2 is not supported
2) Removes "The workaround is to update the driver in bootstrap and
rebuild bootstrap." for Adaptec 6805E RAID, as we do not have
workaround for it at the moment

Change-Id: I808bf744efed7745e682feb87827ac173106e898

commit_message:
Remove ironic running check from inspector startup

This patch removes the check when the inspector starts that ensures
that ironic is already running, because it could lead to problems when
bringing up services in a distributed environment where order and timing
isn't guaranteed.

Change-Id: I2a8ee74db781a087a8ecb0c73ddc461a6b326101
Closes-Bug: #1462993

commit_message:
Add initial "Open Community" chapter

First version of the "Open Community" chapter covering:
- Public meetings on IRC
- Project IRC channels
- Mailing lists
- Community support channels
- Planet OpenStack
- Technical committee and PTL elections

Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

Add a post_test_hook for gate-run functional tests

properly for the gate job. Based on similar changes done for
python-novaclient.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-23 13:39:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add option to print specific fields from an Event

Currently the only way for the client to print an event is to print the
fields in a box-like structure in the command line. This is fine for
many use-cases, but if we want to automate things in the command line,
or pipe some specific field from the event (such as the Event's traits)
then being able to specify which field will be exclusively printed
becomes very useful.

Here's an example:

ceilometer event-show $EVENT_ID -f traits | python -m json.tool

The following would exclusively print the Event's traits (which is
already in JSON format) and the output could be nicely printed in the
command line for further inspection.

Change-Id: I5b9b8fae88a4cef01a4e42513e3b02c633e3c6e2
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-24 09:27:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add option to print specific fields from an Event

commit_message:
Add option to print specific fields

Currently the only way for the client to print an events, alarms or
samples is to print the fields in a box-like structure in the command
line. This is fine for many use-cases, but if we want to automate things
in the command line, or pipe some specific field from the event (such as
the Event's raw data or the Sample's metadata) then being able to
specify which field will be exclusively printed becomes very useful.

Here's an example:

ceilometer sample-show $SAMPLE_ID -f metadata | python -m json.tool

The following would exclusively print the Sample's metadata (which is
already in JSON format) and the output could be nicely printed in the
command line for further inspection.

Change-Id: I5b9b8fae88a4cef01a4e42513e3b02c633e3c6e2

commit_message:
Unbreak the gate

A missing symlink causes the mariadb-app container to fail to build.
This was introduced when we refactored all of the base images.

Partially Implements: blueprint refactor-base-image-layout

commit_message:
Remove redundant policy check from security_group_default_rule

We add check in security_group_default_rules,
user is not necessary to be authorized to security_groups
in order to access security_group_default_rules.
Then this patch removes the security_groups policy
check from security_group_default_rules.

This is related to bp nova-api-policy-final-part
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I221d1056b0101fc5c909222d9cac6739fd106e3f

utils: replace utcnow() by new oslo.utils version

The new oslo.utils.timeutils.utcnow version can now return TZ aware
datetime, so let's use it.

commit_message:
Get minimum required number of controllers from release metadata

The pre-deployment check which ensures a minimum number of controllers
is present in the environment will now take this data from the
roles_metadata in the release. Previously this was hard-coded to
requiring at least one controller.

Change-Id: I95bf6553c81da89d7e840c824491bbddd95a0017
Closes-bug: #1465834

subject: Log that rootwrap was spawned after check
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-12 08:43:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Log that rootwrap was spawned after check

If rootwrap daemon fails to spawn then it's still logged as if it was
spawned due to process is wrapped by sudo that is actually spawned. That
is confusing when debugging. This patch moves the logging message after
it's re-checked whether process was actually spawned.

Change-Id: I1b60e727e5dc90335dabf96877a60e685b7e9a2d
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-19 14:11:41.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_rootwrap/client.py'], 'message': "Log that rootwrap was spawned after check

If rootwrap daemon fails to spawn then it's still logged as if it was
spawned due to process is wrapped by sudo that is actually spawned. That
is confusing when debugging. This patch moves the logging message after
it's re-checked whether process was actually spawned.

Change-Id: I1b60e727e5dc90335dabf96877a60e685b7e9a2d
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Log that rootwrap was spawned after check

If rootwrap daemon fails to spawn then it's still logged as if it was
spawned due to process is wrapped by sudo that is actually spawned. That
is confusing when debugging. This patch moves the logging message after
it's re-checked whether process was actually spawned.

commit_message:
Replace basestring with six.string_types

basestring type is gone in Python 3, use six.string_types to make Cinder code
compatible with Python 3.

This patch was generated by the basestring operation of the sixer tool:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sixer

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: Ie1aedf1cbb9d3e54a996321cd586b875e69ac85a

subject: Enable random hash seeds
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-20 16:19:13.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable random hash seeds

New tox and python3.3 set a random PYTHONHASHSEED value by default.
We should support this in our unittests so that we do not have to
override the PYTHONHASHSEED value and potentially let bugs into our
projects.

Change-Id: I4f62e4b4e079c8659f0974ad783d3c0837426920
Closes-Bug: #1348818
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable random hash seeds

New tox and python3.3 set a random PYTHONHASHSEED value by default.
We should support this in our unittests so that we do not have to
override the PYTHONHASHSEED value and potentially let bugs into our
projects.

Change-Id: I4f62e4b4e079c8659f0974ad783d3c0837426920
Closes-Bug: #1348818

commit_message:
Fix description for trove cluster IP attribute

According to trove docs [1] and code [2] IP is a list.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Trove/Clusters-MongoDB#Show_Cluster
[2] https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/cluster/views.py

Change-Id: Ia3e4bd1574ecbeeb034ed8e282f1b0fd08855458

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-18 18:18:02.000000000', 'files': ['install.sh', 'doc/source/scale_deployment.rst', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

Change-Id: I17e052215ce6e1604cdda848ccc20862452ccbc7
Co-Authored-By: Victor Sergeyev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

Also set the OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION override variable so
that oslo.db opportunistic detection will know to use PyMySQL until
I12b32dc097a121bd43991bc38dd4d289b65e86c1 makes it the default
behavior.

Change-Id: I17e052215ce6e1604cdda848ccc20862452ccbc7
Co-Authored-By: Victor Sergeyev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Use SoftwareDeployments for consistency in extraconfig

Currently we've got a mix of SoftwareConfig resource with
StructuredDeployments resources - while this will work it's
inconsistent and normally using the corresponding
SoftwareDeployments resouce is encourgaged instead.

Change-Id: I308d62d4ff491c073e3e8650fd4c2c65bf96d14a

[{'created': '2015-06-17 21:34:46.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/test_kmip.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_secrets.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_orders.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_rsa.py', 'barbican/tests/common/test_validators.py', 'barbican/tests/utils.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_certificate_orders.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/test_store_crypto.py'], 'message': 'Changed Test Key Size to 2048

commit_message:
Changed Test Key Size to 2048

There were several places where RSA key sizes were less than 2048.
This change makes all of the keys now 2048 bits. This will help tests
with devices that are FIPS compliant and do not allow keys of 1024
bits. This is important for functional tests that use real devices.

The test code included two modules that provided example private key,
public key, and certificate. The utils module was modified to remove
its samples and the keys.py file will now contain the keys to be used
for testing. Those keys are 2048 while utils was 1024.

Change-Id: I19c5b32d7861953ebbb458a6f6336647bb13736c

Currently this leaves a group of baremetalbrbm_$n VMs defined in my
environment, while deleting the baremetal_$n ones.  The "regex" is
really just a prefix for the expected naming convention, so instead
just look for the expected prefix, then all baremetal* nodes are
cleaned up.

Change-Id: Id895ebc7334545b847939c67d818f9eaedc8313e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix cleanup-env baremetal pattern matching

Currently this leaves a group of baremetalbrbm_$n VMs defined in my
environment, while deleting the baremetal_$n ones.  The "regex" is
really just a prefix for the expected naming convention, so instead
just look for the expected prefix, then all baremetal* nodes are
cleaned up.

Change-Id: Id895ebc7334545b847939c67d818f9eaedc8313e

commit_message:
IPA:'shred' utility to use configured iterations

Today, there is no option to configure number of iterations to be
done for shred block device erasing and defaults it to 1. This patch
adds a configuration option to change the number of passes to be done
to erase a block device.

Change-Id: I1921d33a6b364c4682b6c9baaf61ac092cfa11d7
Partial-Bug:#1465130

commit_message:
Restore the old validator sets behaviour

This change brings back the original behaviour of validator sets,
which means each set will be tested separately. If any of the sets
passes all its validators, it will be accepted. If it passes none,
it will be rejected.

This allows multiple configurations to be served from the same
Anchor instance. For example multiple teams can configure separate
source ips allowed to apply for separate hostnames.

Closes-bug: 1463748

Change-Id: Id5f811c6d46bc47ddcc1f751ef8e4e7ffd1254fd

commit_message:
LVM add multiattach flag capability

This patch adds reporting of the multiattach capability
in the lvm driver.   Currently the Cinder scheduler does filtering
on hosts at create time for the --allow-multiattach option being
passed into the create request from the client.   In order for someone
to be able to create an LVM volume that can do multiattach, the LVM
driver needs to report the capability.

This patch's purpose is to allow LVM volumes to be multiattachable
for the folks working on the Nova patches to get Nova to do multiattach.
Without this patch, they can't do end to end testing.

Change-Id: I91942569a12d7c7637c7d9ffb8bbff0daeaf6a97

Closes-Bug: #1466733

commit_message:
Pin keystonemiddleware max version

To resolve requirements conflicts in most painless way before 6.1 GA
let's ping keystonemiddleware to max version 2.0.0 and in 7.0 we
can remove upper bounds as well update packages in our mirros.

Change-Id: I98055060480a2ef80b9d56a211812e98e27fa2e1
Closes-Bug: #1466733

It is possible to create a CSR without a CN, but when
presented it is currently unhandled and therefore we
throw a 500 error.

We can't process a CSR without a CN, so this change

commit_message:
Handle omission of CN on CSR

It is possible to create a CSR without a CN, but when
presented it is currently unhandled and therefore we
throw a 500 error.

We can't process a CSR without a CN, so this change
handles this error and throw a 400 Bad Request instead.

Closes-Bug: 1465349
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>

Change-Id: I5e4d8c7227b492506d67dbbc03c04148f4b13e42

commit_message:
Enable httpd balancing for Horizon

We need to customize the default apache::ip param or the default
vhost configured will listen on ::80

commit_message:
Port test_complex_query to Python 3

* query.py: the message attribute of Exception was removed in Python 3,
  replace e.message with e to format the new error message
* Fix test_complex_query_scenarios: convert
  sample_item["metadata"]["util"] to float; "0.5" >= 0.5 is True in
  Python 2, but it raises a TypeError on Python 3.
* tox.ini: add the following API v2 tests to Python 3.4:

  - test_complex_query_scenarios.TestQueryMetersController.test_query_with_volume_field_name_orderby

Change-Id: I112e5564a65db005cf66ce967a8ac3e52fa95267

commit_message:
Select Libreswan driver for openswan in Fedora

Fedora uses Libreswan for ipsec openswan.
So support for Libreswan driver in neutron VPNaaS will be added by this patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/174299/

Once Libreswan driver is available in neutron VPNaaS,
Devstack should select Libreswan Driver for fedora instead of Openswan driver.

Depends-On: I54558208b2aaa82bda09c0db96042d236eceba69
Change-Id: I287fa0c0c3708c6a9051dda5f426c6841c260dc3
Closes-bug: #1446985

commit_message:
Fix expected error message on Python 3

* Use repr() at runtime instead of using the hardcoded result:
  repr(u'abc') returns 'abc' on Python 3, not u'abc'.
* Add the following api.v2 test to tox.ini for Python 3.4

  - test_alarm_scenarios.TestAlarms.test_get_alarm_history_constrained_by_alarm_id_failed

Change-Id: Ied224b194a73e14c2c04ff3d9837964420ce766c

commit_message:
Fix the inappropriate database initialization in README.rst

* mistral-db-manage command before first run is recommended when using
mysql as db backend.
* For SQLite, mistral-db-manage can't be used for db initialization
because of SQLite ALTER limitations.
* Correct Mistral repo URL.

Change-Id: Ib3c657637cab313e13ddbe8088788fbb9ea9c04f
Closes-Bug: #1465476

subject: Fix usage of iterator/list on Python 3
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 7729, 'name': 'Ilya Tyaptin', 'email': 'ityaptin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ityaptin'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 9562, 'name': 'Ildiko Vancsa', 'email': 'ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com', 'username': 'ildikov'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-15 23:05:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix usage of iterator/list on Python 3

* CombinationEvaluator: on Python 3, convert states (built using zip) to
  a list because states is consumed more than once. On Python 3, zip()
  returns an iterator which can only be consumed once.
* Replace dict.keys()[0] with list(dict.keys())[0]. On Python 3, keys()
  returns an iterator which is not indexable.
* test_event_scenarios: replace filter() with a list-comprehension, the
  test expects a list whereas filter() returns on iterator on Python 3.
* mongo/utils.py: replace obj.keys()[0] with list(obj.keys())[0],

commit_message:
Fix usage of iterator/list on Python 3

* CombinationEvaluator: convert states (built using zip) to a list
  because states is consumed more than once. On Python 3, zip() returns
  an iterator which can only be consumed once.
* Replace dict.keys()[0] with list(dict.keys())[0]. On Python 3, keys()
  returns an iterator which is not indexable.
* test_event_scenarios: replace filter() with a list-comprehension, the
  test expects a list whereas filter() returns on iterator on Python 3.
* mongo/utils.py: replace obj.keys()[0] with list(obj.keys())[0],
  and replace obj.values()[0] with list(obj.values())[0]
* Add the following API v2 tests to tox.ini in Python 3.4:

  - test_event_scenarios.TestEventAPI.test_get_events_filter_datetime_trait

Change-Id: I28bcb65940edbc226c8dbb272f4e3c040ebc37a1

commit_message:
Add the minimum supported vCenter version for the VMware driver

The supported vCenter version for the VMware driver less than
5.1.0 is deprecated. In L this will be logged as a warning.
In M this will be enforced.

Change-Id: Ibbdae1e6f7620412cb7b82c6c83f80b26eef71a0
Closes-Bug: #1463180

commit_message:
Disable keepalived process in keepalived func test

Previously, keepalived process itself was disabled that lead to
respawning of keepalived by KeepalivedManager. This patch disables
KeepalivedManager in cleanup thus no respawn happens.

Closes-Bug: #1466873
Change-Id: If5524116e5d4fc41600920d31481282c5b797f7b

commit_message:
NSX QoS ext: RXTX factor can be decimal

In Nova flavors it is ok to specify a decimal RXTX factor.
For this reason when applying QoS to a port Neutron should not
convert this factor to an integer value, but simply ensure
it's a valid float number and positive.

Partial-Bug: #1463363

Change-Id: I983123ef7fd8f1b52b358aff3b579459fce63033

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-02 16:33:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix cinder concurrency issues on rtstool

Since there's no synchronized access to configfs in rtslib it can happen
that rtstool or rtslib access an element that no longer exists because
it has been removed just in the middle of a loop by another Cinder
request.

This results in quite a different number of exceptions:
- .dump()
- KeyError
- IOError
- RTSLibError on storage_object

This patch synchronizes access to all rtstool calls that access or
modify configfs using utils.synchronized decorator.

Change-Id: I341a10da54ab01be68a0cae843f35e5c841c6d81
Closes-Bug: #1460692
(cherry picked from commit 45c282afb442aec80cf24d226bef5ebb46963026)

commit_message:
Fix cinder concurrency issues on rtstool

Since there's no synchronized access to configfs in rtslib it can happen
that rtstool or rtslib access an element that no longer exists because
it has been removed just in the middle of a loop by another Cinder
request.

This results in quite a different number of exceptions:
- .dump()
- KeyError
- IOError
- RTSLibError on storage_object

This patch synchronizes access to all rtstool calls that access or
modify configfs using utils.synchronized decorator.

Change-Id: I341a10da54ab01be68a0cae843f35e5c841c6d81
Closes-Bug: #1460692
(cherry picked from commit 45c282afb442aec80cf24d226bef5ebb46963026)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/targets/test_lio_driver.py

commit_message:
Converts section_nfs_backend.xml to RST

This patch converts blockstorage/section_nfs_backend.xml
 to blockstorage_nfs_backend.rst
Edits: changed Boolean to boolean, and Compute nodes to
 compute nodes.

Implements: blueprint reorganise-user-guides

Change-Id: I8ca2e72db4e672c127e6c03d3e7d550409d7bf19

commit_message:
Remove _check_ip_in_allocation_pool

_check_ip_in_allocation_pool is not used anywhere in neutron.
Cleaning up unused code from db_base_plugin_v2.py.
Caller was removed over a year ago in change
Ib31550fa9000fc75768a327cb6cc1c419e06568f

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

Change-Id: I41b7254835c308dda679ee2a5ebbccba528fd108

commit_message:
Converts ch_database.xml to RST

This patch converts ch_database.xml to database.rst
Also changes Database service module to Database service
 according to Documentaion conventions.

Implements: blueprint reorganise-user-guides
Change-Id: If3f1902b3c53117d12d57f36e42ce64f73b9e335

commit_message:
Clarify "Limit cloud feature set" para in Methodology

Rework paragraph to avoid duplicate phrase
"recreate the entire OpenStack tool suite" contained in the
"Limit Cloud Feature Set" section in Methodology.

Change-Id: I706b6b09ca1c98fa542a22eefdb577c222a6f186
Closes-Bug: #1398335

commit_message:
Converts section_orchestration_auth-model.xml to RST

This patch:
- adds a translated orchestration_auth-model.rst to the
  openstack-manuals/doc/admin-guide-cloud-rst/source;
- adds an _identity_management header markup to the
  identity_management.rst file (to refer to it in other files);
- corrects several grammar and punctuation mistakes.

Change-Id: Icd9110de71397cab1e8f30ff813562b4e2911765
Implements: blueprint reorganise-user-guides

commit_message:
Add --use-first option to msgcat

When msgcat command merge common-rst po files,
it uses only first msgstr so that Sphinx handles
properly the po file.

Change-Id: I0e744646bfe1fd398cffda316872128d563c893a

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-17 11:31:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Update guru meditation reports from oslo.incubator

The guru meditation reports merged in
f2dc050e4df6ec52a2dad258bb4172ebad47422c
included a very old version of the oslo.incubator code
that did not include fixes introduced one year earlier
to solve a blocking issue on Windows due to the lack of the
signal.SIGUSR1 attribute.

This patch syncs the report modules from oslo.incubator.

Change-Id: I75d1a219425db3d9414024b4c0e1e72b46aa82dd
Closes-Bug: #1286528
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-17 16:50:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/openstack/common/report/guru_meditation_report.py'], 'message': 'Update guru meditation reports from oslo.incubator

The guru meditation reports merged in
f2dc050e4df6ec52a2dad258bb4172ebad47422c
included a very old version of the oslo.incubator code
that did not include fixes introduced one year earlier
to solve a blocking issue on Windows due to the lack of the
signal.SIGUSR1 attribute.

This patch corresponds to oslo.incubator commit:

commit_message:
Update guru meditation reports from oslo.incubator

The guru meditation reports merged in
f2dc050e4df6ec52a2dad258bb4172ebad47422c
included a very old version of the oslo.incubator code
that did not include fixes introduced one year earlier
to solve a blocking issue on Windows due to the lack of the
signal.SIGUSR1 attribute.

This patch corresponds to oslo.incubator commit:
d3a285e33fa936cec5d14dfefa20dc03cc90ac18

Change-Id: I75d1a219425db3d9414024b4c0e1e72b46aa82dd
Closes-Bug: #1286528

commit_message:
Remove admin auth from glance

These options allow glance to fetch and use an admin token instead of
using the user token for operations. To use the admin token you need to
set use_user_token=False in those options which devstack doesn't do.

Therefore these options are being ignored and they should be removed.

Change-Id: I91ac6343e5b91c292a00e73f13a82cee63837070

commit_message:
Add v2 support for the marker attribute

The v2 Glance client implementation ignores the marker attribute if
it's passed to the client as part of the kwargs.  Include support
for the attribute, as the v1 client supports it and it makes it
easier to work with the Glance client.

Change-Id: Ifaa59129bc4178212b890ea591673cb154e0f110
Closes-bug: 1465373

Move listener rpc client to rpc/listener_client.py

the listener API.

commit_message:
convergence: sync_point fixes

This is a merge of 4 reviews:
I52f1611d34def3474acba0e5eee054e11c5fc5ad
Ic374a38c9d76763be341d3a80f53fa396c9c2256
Iecd21ccb4392369f66fa1b3a0cf55aad754aeac4
I77b81097d2dcf01efa540237ed5ae14896ed1670

- make sure sender is a tuple (otherwise the serialization
  function in sync_point breaks.)
- Update updated_time on any lifecycle operation(CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE)
  over a stack.
- adjust sync_point logic to account for deletes
   Done by having only a single stack sync point
   for both updates and deletes.
- Serialize/deserialize input_data for RPC
- Make GraphKey's the norm in convergence worker
- move temp_update_requires functionality to tests
  During intial stages of convergence to simulate the entire cycle
  some part of worker code was written in stack.py.
  Now that the convergence worker is implemented, this code needs to
  be executed only in tests.
- Fix dictionary structure that's passed to resoure.(create/update)
- Temporarily disable loading cache_data for stack to help fix other
  issues.

Change-Id: Iecd21ccb4392369f66fa1b3a0cf55aad754aeac4
Co-Authored-by: Sirushti Murugesan <sirushti.murugesan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-by: Rakesh H S <rh-s@hp.com>

commit_message:
Put glance into multi-tenant mode

Glance single-tenant mode does not support v3 authentication. Use multi-tenant
mode to allow for V3 only testing.

This should not be merged.

Change-Id: I1d78ce608a9866595b3b7c094a9260d66f04e94a

commit_message:
Don't enforce an unscoped token has no catalog

As part of a keystone blueprint we are looking at adding a restricted
catalog to an unscoped token. Tempest shouldn't enforce that there is no
catalog in a token.

Change-Id: Ie889830070b9c83470cadd6fbb3eb74bd3368df8
Blueprint: unscoped-catalog

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-02-06 11:35:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make Pecan the root routing framework

Replace the core of keystone routing with Pecan. All the original
controllers are still used and handed off if there is not a valid pecan
route (which is only versioning now).

There are a number of changes here together because they don't
always work separately. Things like moving exception handling to a hook
can work individually but is difficult to mix and match with the
existing infrastructure.

In this patch we start to separate the v2 and v3 APIs into individual
folders that can be continued later.

commit_message:
Make Pecan the root routing framework

Replace the core of keystone routing with Pecan. All the original
controllers are still used and handed off if there is not a valid pecan
route (which is only versioning now).

There are a number of changes here together because they don't
always work separately. Things like moving exception handling to a hook
can work individually but is difficult to mix and match with the
existing infrastructure.

In this patch we start to separate the v2 and v3 APIs into individual
folders that can be continued later.

Blueprint: keystone-pecan
Change-Id: I0172ced01bb4017d184f1d2091dba7444e59df8b

commit_message:
Remove versioned identity endpoint from catalog

The v2 identity API is going away. One of the important steps is to
remove the versioned endpoint from the identity endpoint in favour of
the root version list url.

Change-Id: I1263e1af53e7abb382d6fdafc47e91c2774d953b

commit_message:
Create an admin domain and cloud_admin user

Move towards a full keystone v3 setup. We create the admin domain and
create a user that is capable of managing domains. To do this we need to
create the users, modify the config and restart the keystone service
with the new policy information.

Change-Id: I43160a888503bd6b2112a874b134b93d9962e53c

commit_message:
Fix enabled/dependency relationship in project dashboard

This patch addresses the problem that the fixed
dependencies in the hz.dashboard module are dependent on
javascript being loaded from an "enabled" file that might
be disabled, thus breaking the module, and the application.

Change-Id: I3d89c5e652e152f030f5e2e0ffeaebb071ad4e5e
Closes-Bug: 1466713

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-24 07:58:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add volume drivers for Infortrend Storage

Infortrend implement ISCSI and FC volume drivers for EonStor DS product (DS1000, DS3000)
It manages storage by Infortrend CLI tool.

common_cli.py implements the basic Cinder Driver API.
infortrend_fc_cli.py and infortrend_iscsi_cli.py use them to provide FC and iSCSI specific support.

Support features:
- Volume Create/Delete
- Volume Attach/Detach
- Snapshot Create/Delete
- Create Volume from Snapshot
- Get Volume Stats
- Copy Image to Volume
- Copy Volume to Image
- Clone Volume
- Extend Volume

Change-Id: I830c5a48a5fb85707f02396b4634825e27455e8a
Implements: blueprint infortrend-iscsi-fc-volume-driver

commit_message:
Add volume drivers for Infortrend Storage

Infortrend implement ISCSI and FC volume drivers for
EonStor DS product.
It manages storage by Infortrend CLI tool.

common_cli.py implements the basic Cinder Driver API.
infortrend_fc_cli.py and infortrend_iscsi_cli.py use them to
provide FC and iSCSI specific support.

Support features:
- Volume Create/Delete
- Volume Attach/Detach
- Snapshot Create/Delete
- Create Volume from Snapshot
- Get Volume Stats
- Copy Image to Volume
- Copy Volume to Image
- Clone Volume
- Extend Volume

Change-Id: I830c5a48a5fb85707f02396b4634825e27455e8a
Implements: blueprint infortrend-iscsi-fc-volume-driver

commit_message:
Fix external links

Run "sphinx -b linkcheck" on the RST directories and fix problems found.
In most cases, it's a redirect from http to https.

Change-Id: Ib56ea42f5fd14de3fa79e0559b8086fed6173a0a
